ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Lost in translation.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: family10  To:  Sent: Thursday, January 29, 2004 6:38 PM Subject: [EverQuest] Lost in translation. ...
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "family10" <family10@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 29, 2004 6:38 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Lost in translation.


> Thanks to everyone for helping me to learn how to create and configure
> spare chat screens. Now someone has thrown me another mystery to
solve. A
> player sent me the following words:
> "Link your wep pls?"
> Ok. I figured out that a wep is a weapon. When I asked him what he
meant,
> he said that he wanted to link with my hammer. I have an Intel's
Hammer.
> However, I have no idea what he means by linking him to it or how to
do it.
> Somebody please throw this poor newbe a clue. G. I'm playing a level
24 vah
> shir shaman. Great goddess, there is something totally new to learn
> everything I log on.

If you hold down the ALT key while clicking on an item it will open up a
persistent window describing its stats. If you then click on the icon of
the item that appears in this window (the top right corner of the
window), it will paste a hot-link with the name of the item into your
chat bar at the current cursor location. You can use this procedure to
pass a hot-link to other people, who can then click on the link (the
name of the item) on their screen, which will then open up the items
description window on their computer.

You can have up to 4 item windows open at once, subsequent items will
replace the contents of the 4th window opened.'

You will often notice item names appearing in different colour to the
surrounding text as you play (they updated the loot message to use these
hotlinks too). If you click on the highlighted text you will see the
item window, with all the stats for that item.

Matt


---
